1:
My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?\q Why are you so far from saving me and far from the words of my anguish?
\q
2:
My God, I cry out in the daytime, but you do not answer,\q and at night I am not silent!


\q
3:
Yet you are holy;\q you sit as king with the praises of Israel.
\q
4:
Our ancestors trusted in you;\q they trusted in you, and you rescued them.
\q
5:
They cried to you and they were rescued.\q They trusted in you and were not disappointed.


\q
6:
But I am a worm and not a man,\q a disgrace to humanity and despised by the people.
\q
7:
All those who see me taunt me;\q they mock me; they shake their heads at me.
\q
8:
They say, "He trusts in Yahweh;\q let Yahweh rescue him.
\q Let him rescue him, for he delights in him."


\q
9:
For you brought me from the womb;\q you made me trust you when I was on my mother's breasts.
\q
10:
I have been thrown on you from the womb;\q you are my God since I was in my mother's womb!


\q
11:
Do not be far away from me, for trouble is near;\q there is no one to help.
\q
12:
Many bulls surround me;\q strong bulls of Bashan surround me.
\q
13:
They open their mouths wide against me\q like a roaring lion ripping its victim.


\q
14:
I am being poured out like water,\q and all my bones are dislocated.
\q My heart is like wax;
\q it melts away within my inner parts.
\q
15:
My strength has dried up like a piece of pottery;\q my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
\q You have laid me in the dust of death.


\q
17:
I can count all my bones.\q They look and stare at me.


\q
18:
They divide my garments among themselves,\q they cast lots for my clothes.
\q
19:
Do not be far away, Yahweh;\q please hurry to help me, my strength!


\q
20:
Rescue my soul from the sword,\q my only life from the claws of wild dogs.
\q
21:
Save me from the lion's mouth;\q rescue me from the horns of the wild oxen.


\q
22:
I will declare your name to my brothers;\q in the midst of the assembly I will praise you.
\q
23:
You who fear Yahweh, praise him!\q All you descendants of Jacob, honor him!
\q Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!


\q
25:
My praise will be because of you in the great assembly;\q I will fulfill my vows before those who fear him.


\q
26:
The oppressed will eat and be satisfied;\q those who seek Yahweh will praise him.
\q May your hearts live forever.
\q
27:
All the peoples of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh;\q all the families of the nations will bow down before you.


\q
28:
For the kingdom is Yahweh's;\q he is the ruler over the nations.
\q
29:
All the prosperous people of the earth will feast and will worship;\q all those who are descending into the dust will bow before him,
\q those who cannot preserve their own lives.


\q
30:
A generation to come will serve him;\q they will tell the next generation of the Lord.
\q
31: They will come and tell of his righteousness;\q they will tell to a people not yet born what he has done!
